qa.question: What do you mainly use your phone for?
qa.answer: WhatsApp to talk with customers, send blouse designs, and for family calls. Sometimes YouTube tutorials.

qa.question: Do you share your phone with others?
qa.answer: I share with my husband if he needs to call. My children sometimes use it for games.

qa.question: What are your favorite apps?
qa.answer: WhatsApp and YouTube. I never thought about what they take from my phone.

qa.question: Do you read permissions?
qa.answer: I tried once but got scared. Too many confusing words.

qa.question: How do you decide if an app is safe?
qa.answer: If my brother or neighbor uses it, I trust it.

qa.question: Have you deleted content?
qa.answer: Yes, I delete WhatsApp chats from customers after work is done.

qa.question: What do you do before repair?
qa.answer: I go to a local shop. I never delete anything.

qa.question: Have you asked for help?
qa.answer: I ask my brother or neighbor’s son. I feel shy if they see my chats.

qa.question: Who do you trust most?
qa.answer: I trust my sister the most.

qa.question: Do you use code words?
qa.answer: No, I just delete if I don’t want others to see.

qa.question: Have you helped someone install an app?
qa.answer: Once I helped my neighbor download a blouse design app, but I only pressed Allow.

qa.question: Do you know how to stop permissions?
qa.answer: No, I don’t know how.

qa.question: What do you do with warnings?
qa.answer: I get scared and ask my brother.

qa.question: What do you think happens when you give access?
qa.answer: I think the app can see photos when I open it.

qa.question: Have you hesitated to repair?
qa.answer: Yes, but I still go. I just pray they don’t laugh.

qa.question: Has a repair person opened your apps?
qa.answer: Yes, once the shop boy opened WhatsApp. I felt bad but didn’t say anything.

qa.question: Do you use a password?
qa.answer: I use a simple PIN lock. Only my husband knows it.

qa.question: Do you think local apps are safer?
qa.answer: I don’t know which is local or foreign.

qa.question: Who do you turn to?
qa.answer: I ask my brother or neighbor’s children.

qa.question: Do people influence your safety thinking?
qa.answer: Yes, I stopped clicking unknown links after my brother warned me.

scenarios.Broken Phone: I run to the shop. I don’t know how to delete things.
scenarios.Sharing Phone: If my husband takes my phone, I quickly delete some chats with customers.
scenarios.New App: If my neighbor says it’s good, I install and press Allow.
scenarios.Helping Elderly Relative: If my aunt asks, I just install for her.
scenarios.Borrowed Phone: If I see someone’s private photo, I keep quiet.
scenarios.Giving Away Phone: I remove SIM and memory card, delete some photos, and give it.
scenarios.Cloud Backup: If deleted photos come back, I feel scared.
scenarios.Free WiFi: I connect for YouTube, but not Paytm.
scenarios.Lottery Call: I cut the call. My brother told me it’s cheating.
scenarios.Emergency Transfer: If my close friend asks, I will call her to confirm first.
